title: EWL Track Work - Tanah Merah and Simei stations

title_translations.ms: Stesen Tanah Merah dan Simei ditutup untuk penyenggaraan, bas pengantara disediakan
title_translations.ta: தானா மேரா மற்றும் சிமெய் நிலையங்கள் பராமரிப்புக்காக மூடப்பட்டன, ஷட்டில் பேருந்துகள் வழங்கப்படுகின்றன

updates.text: East-West Line (EWL) track testing near newly connected sections from Bedok and Kembangan causes longer waits of up to 17 minutes. A final service suspension to disconnect EWL from Changi Depot is planned for the first half of 2026.

Disruption on the East-West Line (EWL) on 2 Dec due to a track fault caused at least 20 minutes of extra travel time for eight stations from Bugis to Bedok, with Paya Lebar among the affected stations; shuttle services operated between Paya Lebar and Bedok amid eastern track work, fueling passenger confusion due to limited official alerts. On 3 Dec, LTA said operators would prioritise station-level alerts for minor delays and work toward location-based information online, possibly via a central app, to improve journey planning.

From 29 November to 8 December 2025, East-West Line's Simei and Tanah Merah stations will be closed. There will be no train service on the East-West Line between Bedok and Tampines stations, and Tanah Merah and Expo stations. Please use alternative MRT lines and bus services.
LTA estimates 180,000 passengers could be affected daily over the 10 days of service adjustments.
Shuttle buses will run between the affected stations during the closures, which are expected to impact about 180,000 commuters.
